newsitem.title: UK: Four Brent dates kept, one clocked - trade.
newsitem.headline: Four Brent dates kept, one clocked - trade.

text.p: Four of the five Brent cargoes nominated loading dates on Friday were kept ahead of the five o'clock deadline, while another was left unclaimed, traders said.
Stasco and Shell UK each kept one cargo loading July 19-21, Texaco was clocked with a cargo loading July 20-22, while Stasco and Statoil each kept one cargo loading July 21-23, they said.
Brent cargoes are traded on a paper, or forward market
until the 1700 London time deadline on the nearest trading day 15 days before their assigned loading date.
A trading company is clocked when it is left with a cargo which has changed from paper to physical at the deadline and therefore can no longer be passed on as part of pre-sold paper cargo deals.
